parts.prose: Select incident response strategies for active incidents by balancing the need to quickly recover from an incident with the need to observe the attacker or conduct a more thorough investigation

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Incidents are escalated or elevated as needed

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Track and validate the status of all ongoing incidents

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Coordinate incident escalation or elevation with designated internal and external stakeholders

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The criteria for initiating incident recovery are applied

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Apply incident recovery criteria to known and assumed characteristics of the incident to determine whether incident recovery processes should be initiated

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Take the possible operational disruption of incident recovery activities into account

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Activities are performed to prevent expansion of an event and mitigate its effects

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Incidents are contained

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Cybersecurity technologies (e.g., antivirus software) and cybersecurity features of other technologies (e.g., operating systems, network infrastructure devices) automatically perform containment actions

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Allow incident responders to manually select and perform containment actions

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Allow a third party (e.g., internet service provider, managed security service provider) to perform containment actions on behalf of the organization

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Automatically transfer compromised endpoints to a remediation virtual local area network (VLAN)

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Incidents are eradicated

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Cybersecurity technologies and cybersecurity features of other technologies (e.g., operating systems, network infrastructure devices) automatically perform eradication actions

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Allow incident responders to manually select and perform eradication actions

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Allow a third party (e.g., managed security service provider) to perform eradication actions on behalf of the organization

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Newly identified vulnerabilities are mitigated or documented as accepted risks

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Response plan is executed during or after an incident

parts.name: overview
parts.prose: Assets and operations affected by a cybersecurity incident are restored

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Restoration activities are coordinated with internal and external parties

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Public relations are managed

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Reputation is repaired after an incident

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Recovery activities and progress in restoring operational capabilities are communicated to designated internal and external stakeholders

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Securely share recovery information, including restoration progress, consistent with response plans and information sharing agreements

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Regularly update senior leadership on recovery status and restoration progress for major incidents

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Follow the rules and protocols defined in contracts for incident information sharing between the organization and its suppliers

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Coordinate crisis communication between the organization and its critical suppliers

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Public updates on incident recovery are shared using approved methods and messaging

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Follow the organization's breach notification procedures for recovering from a data breach incident

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Explain the steps being taken to recover from the incident and to prevent a recurrence

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Recovery plans incorporate lessons learned

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Recovery strategies are updated

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Restoration activities are performed to ensure operational availability of systems and services affected by cybersecurity incidents

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The recovery portion of the incident response plan is executed once initiated from the incident response process

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Begin recovery procedures during or after incident response processes

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Make all individuals with recovery responsibilities aware of the plans for recovery and the authorizations required to implement each aspect of the plans

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Recovery actions are selected, scoped, prioritized, and performed

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Select recovery actions based on the criteria defined in the incident response plan and available resources

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Change planned recovery actions based on a reassessment of organizational needs and resources

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The integrity of backups and other restoration assets is verified before using them for restoration

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Check restoration assets for indicators of compromise, file corruption, and other integrity issues before use

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: Critical mission functions and cybersecurity risk management are considered to establish post-incident operational norms

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Use business impact and system categorization records (including service delivery objectives) to validate that essential services are restored in the appropriate order

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Work with system owners to confirm the successful restoration of systems and the return to normal operations

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Monitor the performance of restored systems to verify the adequacy of the restoration

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The integrity of restored assets is verified, systems and services are restored, and normal operating status is confirmed

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Check restored assets for indicators of compromise and remediation of root causes of the incident before production use

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Verify the correctness and adequacy of the restoration actions taken before putting a restored system online

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: The end of incident recovery is declared based on criteria, and incident-related documentation is completed

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Prepare an after-action report that documents the incident itself, the response and recovery actions taken, and lessons learned

parts.name: example
parts.prose: Declare the end of incident recovery once the criteria are met
